items.name: De Niro
items.symbolism: The "Cool Capitalist." Represents handling business with cinematic style and street-smart nuance.

items.name: Michael Jordan (M.J.)
items.symbolism: The ultimate standard of competitive dominance and aerial grace. Represents "Chicago Energy"—grit combined with flight.

items.name: Mozart
items.symbolism: The "Prodigy." Used to elevate rap lyrics to the status of high classical art. Represents genius that flows effortlessly.
items.key_reference: "Turn bars like Mozart," "Art in the arc."

items.name: Da Vinci
items.symbolism: The "polymath builder." Represents the duality of being both an artist (sketch) and an engineer (code/structure).

items.name: Prince
items.symbolism: Mystique and Ownership. Represents creative independence and owning your own masters/sound.
items.key_reference: "Prince in the mystique," "Ownership in the sound."

items.name: Steve Jobs
items.symbolism: The Visionary. Represents seeing the future before it happens and designing it with precision.
items.key_reference: "Apple-bite in the crown," "Jobs in the vision."

items.name: Wayne (Lil Wayne)
items.symbolism: The Evolution of Craft. Represents the shift from a "hot rapper" to a "Martian/Wizard" level of skill.

items.name: Allen Iverson
items.symbolism: The Crossover. Represents disruption, changing the pace, and individualism against the establishment.

items.name: Gretzky
items.symbolism: Anticipation. Skating to where the puck is *going* to be (Due Time), not where it is.

items.name: Ada (Lovelace)
items.symbolism: The First Coder. Represents the deep roots of the "Mainframe" and "Logic" themes in the tech-heavy tracks.

items.name: Miles (Davis)
items.symbolism: The Type." Represents cool innovation and the ability to say more with fewer notes (signals).

items.name: Dalai Lama
items.symbolism: Inner Strength. Represents the paradox of being "calm" while being "strong" and "unbothered."

items.name: Zeppelin (Led Zeppelin)
items.symbolism: Classic Rock Elevation. Used to invoke the "Stairway" metaphor and the sheer size/scale of the sound.

items.name: James Bond / 007
items.symbolism: Suave Execution. Represents getting the job done while looking impeccable. "Word is Bond."

items.name: Don McLean
items.symbolism: Americana storytelling and nostalgia.

items.name: The Beatles
items.symbolism: Psychedelic Whimsy. Represents the "Strawberry Fields" spirit of playfulness within the music.

items.name: The Wizard (of Oz)
items.symbolism: The Architect of Reality. Not the "man behind the curtain," but the **Wizard with a Capital Z**—true mastery and control over the "Oz" dominion.
items.context: The ultimate goal of the "Builder" arc.

items.name: Dorothy's Crew (Lion, Tin Man, Scarecrow)
items.symbolism: The Balanced Self. Represents the internal trinity of **Heart** (Lion), **Logic/Planning** (Tin Man), and **Vision** (Scarecrow).

items.name: Alice (in Wonderland)
items.symbolism: The Perspective Shift. Used when the flow or beat changes size/shape ("Eat me / Drink me").

items.name: Cheshire Cat
items.symbolism: The Knowing Grin. Represents confidence in the unknown and fading in/out of the "Gray."

items.name: Peter Pan / Neverland
items.symbolism: Eternal Youth. Represents the refusal to let the "Child Spirit" die, even while doing business.

items.name: Hercules
items.symbolism: Moral Strength. Represents doing the right thing when it's heavy ("Atlas" energy).

items.name: Hades
items.symbolism: The Schemer. Represents "Disney Villain" energy—shadowy figures plotting against the light.

items.name: Edward Scissorhands
items.symbolism: Precision and Isolation. Represents being misunderstood but capable of creating beautiful, delicate art (trimming the hedges).

items.name: Jojo Rabbit
items.symbolism: Innocence amidst War. Represents keeping a good heart (the rabbit) even when the world is harsh.

items.name: Buzz Lightyear
items.symbolism: Infinite Ambition. Used for the "Infinite and Beyond" hook.

items.name: The Lorax
items.symbolism: Growth and Protection. The guardian of the "Money Trees" and the seeds.
items.key_reference: "Speak for the trees," "Money trees down on me."

items.name: Joker
items.symbolism: Chaotic Resilience. Laughing through the stress/pain.

items.name: Tom (Tom & Jerry)
items.symbolism: Relentless Pursuit. The energy of chasing the goal, even if you take hits.

items.name: Thomas (The Tank Engine)
items.symbolism: Reliable Motion. "I think I can." The steady, chugging beat of the "Freight Train."

items.name: Mr. Meeseeks (Rick & Morty)
items.symbolism: Singular Purpose. Existing *only* to complete the task, then disappearing (dip quick).

items.name: Mr. Elastic / Mr. Fantastic
items.symbolism: Versatility. Stretching the flow, the cadence, or the reach without breaking.

items.name: Jack (and the Beanstalk)
items.symbolism: Humble Beginnings. Starting with "magic beans" (seeds) and growing a massive outcome.

items.name: Spidey (Spider-Man)
items.symbolism: Instinct. The "Spidey Sense" that detects "Static" or "Danger" before it hits.

items.name: Pandora
items.symbolism: The Container of Chaos. "Pandora's Box" is referenced as something JaZeR *refuses* to open, or locks away to protect his peace.

items.name: Lucy Diamond
items.symbolism: The Muse. A reference to "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds"—she brings "supplies" (inspiration) from the sky.

items.name: Pac-Man
items.symbolism: The Game. Navigating the maze and avoiding the "ghosts" (negative energy).

items.name: The Bees
items.symbolism: The Workers. Represents the natural, busy energy of growth and pollination.

items.name: Oz
items.significance: The Ultimate Goal. Represents the place where the "Yellow Bricks" (work) lead. It is Technicolor, magical, and earned.

items.name: Chicago
items.significance: The Windy City. Represents the "North Wind," grit, and the sports DNA (Bulls/Jordan) that fuels the competitive drive.

items.name: Austin
items.significance: The Base. Where the "Swirl" happens. The home ground.

items.name: The Factory
items.significance: The Studio. Where raw pressure is processed into "Cheese" (Money/Product).

items.name: Space Station
items.significance: The Mental State. High altitude, zero gravity, total isolation/focus.

items.name: The Pacific
items.significance: The Flow. Represents depth, vastness, and a current that cannot be stopped.

items.name: Maldives / Tropics / The Caribbean
items.significance: The Reward. The "Dream" side of the ledger. Represents peace, luxury, and "squishy" sunshine energy.

items.name: Wonderland
items.significance: The Imagination. Where physics don't apply.

items.name: Strawberry Fields
items.significance: A mental space of nostalgia and freedom.

items.name: Augusta
items.significance: Referenced as a starting point or marker for the "Skyline."

items.name: The Nile
items.significance: Timelessness. A flow that has sustained civilizations.

items.name: Pluto
items.significance: The Outsider. Represents being far out, distant, and misunderstood but still orbiting.

items.name: The Matrix
items.significance: The Illusion. "Leaning back" refers to dodging bullets/lies.

items.name: Dark Side of the Moon
items.significance: The Unknown. Cruising where others can't see.

items.name: Air Force Uno
items.meaning: A personalized spin on "Air Force One." It represents singular importance—JaZeR is the President of his own flight.

items.name: Ferragamo
items.meaning: Tasteful Luxury. "Stepping light" implies moving with expensive grace.

items.name: Jordan (Jordans)
items.meaning: Iconic Style. "Tip-toeing in my Jordans" mixes stealth with classic sneaker culture.

items.name: VW (Volkswagens / B-Dubs)
items.meaning: Grounding. Represents engineering, reliability, and personal history.

items.name: Jeep
items.meaning: Rugged Utility. Often used as a comparison ("You thought it was a Jeep, but it's a Jet").

items.name: Cadillac
items.meaning: Classic status (often used for the "Cataracts" wordplay).

items.name: Tussie Pop
items.meaning: Layers. "How many licks to the center?" Represents getting to the core truth.

items.name: Swisher House
items.meaning: Southern Rap Culture. Refers to "Chopped & Screwed" slowed-down energy.

items.name: Swiss (Watch)
items.meaning: Precision. "Swiss timing" means hitting the beat perfectly.

items.name: Starlink
items.meaning: Next-Gen Connection. "Shimmer" represents high-speed, satellite-based communication from the sky.

items.name: FL Studio
items.meaning: The Canvas. The software where the "shine" is built.

items.name: Java
items.meaning: Code. Used to contrast with "Script" or natural flow.

items.name: Team Reckless
items.description: The collective identity of the crew. Brave, bold, and willing to take risks.

items.name: Zoo-op-a-ree
items.description: A playful phonetic description of the chaotic "clan" or entourage gravitating around the artist.

items.name: K-Dog
items.description: A specific crew member referenced as a pillar of strength ("In the corner").

items.name: Kaber
items.description: Referenced in *Dark Side Cruise*—part of the flight crew.
